jvelociter - (11:01): hi vmassol  
vmassol - (11:02): jvelociter: hi  
jvelociter - (11:02): busy today? I volunteer to write a migration script for code macros snippets etc. to the new extensions  
vmassol - (11:02): jvelociter: I'm on extensions.xwiki.org today  
vmassol - (11:02): so great  
jvelociter - (11:03): cool  
vmassol - (11:03): I'm starting to write the sheet at last  
vmassol - (11:03): we can work together  
jvelociter - (11:05): ok, I'll start writing this script. Will not create any page yet until we have the class/sheet finished though  
vmassol - (11:05): ok  
vmassol - (11:05): great  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 11:12  
jvelociter - (11:14): vmassol: I'm going to change the type static list to use typekey=Pretty Name pairs  
vmassol - (11:15): ok, but what is this?  
vmassol - (11:15): (never used it)  
jvelociter - (11:15): snippet=Snippet|wikimacro=Macro (Wiki)|javamacro=Macro (Java)|velocimacro=Macro (Velocity)|radeoxmacro=Macro (Radeox)|plugin=Plugin|application=Application|skin=Skin|components=Components|other=Other  
jvelociter - (11:16): it allows to have a different stored value than the displayed value  
vmassol - (11:16): ah ok cool, didn't know this  
vmassol - (11:16): how do you use it?  
jvelociter - (11:16): it's easier to manipulate in scripting  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:17  
abusenius left at 11:20 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvelociter - (11:44): vmassol: how do you see the naming scheme for new extensions pages ?  
vmassol - (11:44): jvelociter: located in the Extension space to start with  
jvelociter - (11:45): Extensions.${name}Extension ?  
jvelociter - (11:45): or no suffix ?  
vmassol - (11:45): sounds good. Not sure we need the suffix since it's an extension space  
jvelociter - (11:45): yes I agree  
jvelociter - (11:45): now for former pages  
jvelociter - (11:45): like Applications.TagApplication  
jvelociter - (11:46): Extensions.Tag ? :/  
jvelociter - (11:46): or we keep the old suffix?  
vmassol - (11:46): hmmm  
vmassol - (11:46): there are possible classes  
vmassol - (11:46): a tag plugin, tag snippet, tag applicaiton  
vmassol - (11:46): s/classes/clashes/  
jvelociter - (11:46): yes  
jvelociter - (11:47): so we keep the suffix on a case by case ?  
vmassol - (11:47): yes and the suffix is more the type rather than "Extension"  
vmassol - (11:47): it's a better qualifier  
jvelociter - (11:48): yes. No suffix by default and when we need disambiguation we add the type  
jvelociter - (11:52): actually the page name does not matter too much  
vmassol - (11:53): I think a type suffix would be a good best practice though  
jvelociter - (11:57): vmassol: actually yes  
jvelociter - (11:57): we should keep it for all IMO  
jvelociter - (11:57): (and it's easier for me now :) )  
vmassol - (11:58): yes  
vmassol - (12:12): jvelociter: do you know how to get the selected values from the bundledWith field?     #set($bundledWith = $doc.getValue("bundledWith"))  
vmassol - (12:13):         #foreach($bundle in $bundledWith)  
vmassol - (12:13):           \* $bundle  
vmassol - (12:13):         #end  
vmassol - (12:13): doesn't seem to work  
jvelociter - (12:13): what does it do ?  
vmassol - (12:13): empty  
jvelociter - (12:14): ah  
jvelociter - (12:14): that's because it will give it to you as a string already  
jvelociter - (12:14): if you really want a list  
jvelociter - (12:14): you have to do  
jvelociter - (12:15): $object.getProperty('bundledWith').value  
jvelociter - (12:15): can I edit ?  
vmassol - (12:15): hold on  
vmassol - (12:16): go  
vmassol - (12:16): (you can edit)  
arkub joined #xwiki at 12:21  
jstoldt - (12:23): euh... why are all translation for XE Core set to 0?  
jstoldt - (12:23): http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources  
vmassol - (12:24): thomasM should be able to help but he's offline right now  
jstoldt - (12:25): sure, just wanted to check if there is anything to do but right now it seems like something broke  
vmassol - (12:35): jvelociter: are you done with the sheet?  
jvelociter - (12:35): ah no, did not see your answer  
jvelociter - (12:35): 1 minute  
vmassol - (12:35): k  
vmassol - (12:36): jvelociter:hey you broke my changes  
jstoldt - (12:36): hmmm sorting the macros list by name fails...  
vmassol - (12:36): supported by was working  
vmassol - (12:37): you sure you didn't overwrite my changes?  
jvelociter - (12:37): vmassol: arf let me rollback to your vertsion  
vmassol - (12:37): ok  
vmassol - (12:37): jstoldt: where?  
jstoldt - (12:37): code.xwiki.org  
jstoldt - (12:37): macro list  
vmassol - (12:38): jstoldt: that's a question for jvelociter…. the livetable has issues with titles  
vmassol - (12:38): jvelociter: should we use page name instead of titles for now on code.xwiki.org?  
jstoldt - (12:39): i think anything would be an improvement ;)  
jvelociter - (12:39): yes maybe  
vmassol - (12:39): jstoldt: you're harsh, it's better than before  
vmassol - (12:41): jvelociter: how do we get the livetable to sort on the titles and default to page name when no title?  
jstoldt - (12:41): vmassol: i didn't mean to be harsh, i meant anything that would actually sort the title by the alphabet would be an improvement  
jstoldt - (12:41): that means to say it doesn't really matter (to me) if it's the title of the page or the name of the page  
jvelociter - (12:41): vmassol: you have to modify the soure  
jvelociter - (12:41): \*data source  
jstoldt - (12:42): because in this particular list they are pretty much exchangeable for all i can see  
vmassol - (12:42): jvelociter: would be good to have jira issues for title handing for the LT  
vmassol - (12:42): so that we don't forget to fix them  
jvelociter - (12:42): yes  
vmassol - (12:42): for now I'll use page names on code.xwiki.org  
jvelociter - (12:43): I don't understand why getProperty('bundledWith').value gives me a string  
jvelociter - (12:43): that's not normal  
jvelociter - (12:43): I use to use this all the time for lists  
jvelociter - (12:43): + the javadoc says :  
jvelociter - (12:43):     Returns:  
jvelociter - (12:43):         the actual value of the property, as a String, Number or List.  
jvelociter - (12:43): http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/releases/archive/com/xpn/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core/2.6/xwiki-core-2.6-javadoc.jar/!/index.html  
jvelociter - (12:44): ah I know  
jvelociter - (12:45): vmassol: it's because you did not checked "Multiple Select"  
vmassol - (12:45): jstoldt: done  
jstoldt - (12:45): awesome, thanks a bunch  
jvelociter - (12:46): vmassol: OK done  
vmassol - (12:47): jvelociter: thanks  
jvelociter - (12:50): vmassol: we map old content field to description, and we leave summary empty OK ?  
jvelociter - (12:50): (for the migration)  
jstoldt - (12:50): sorts just fine now!  
vmassol - (12:50): didn't we have summary before?  
vmassol - (12:50): checking  
vmassol - (12:50): it was "description"  
vmassol - (12:51): (for applications)  
vmassol - (12:51): old "content" is new "description"  
vmassol - (12:51): :)  
jstoldt - (12:53): am i too blind to find some documentation on the container macro?  
vmassol - (12:53): lucaa: ?  
jvelociter - (12:53): yes vmassol so we did not had summary right ?  
vmassol - (12:54): it was called "descirption"  
jvelociter - (12:54): ah  
jvelociter - (12:54): description  
jvelociter - (12:54): ok  
jvelociter - (12:54): just for apps  
vmassol - (12:54): yes  
lucaa - (12:54): vmassol: ?  
lucaa - (12:54): ah container macro  
lucaa - (12:54): jstoldt: no, there is no documentation, yet, unfortunately  
vmassol - (12:55): lucaa: yes, do we have doc for it and if not could you create it ?  
lucaa - (12:55): but I could help you here, until the documentation is there  
vmassol - (12:55): lucaa: better start the dc  
vmassol - (12:55): will take the same amount of time and it'll be ther  
vmassol - (12:55): :)  
vmassol - (12:55): s/dc/doc/  
jstoldt - (12:56): okay, so what i am basically trying to achieve is a line at the end of a document where i got a left justified text with a link on the left and a right justified text with a link on the right  
jstoldt - (12:56): for navigation between pages that belong to gether  
vmassol - (12:56): lucaa: remember the strategy: answer questions with a link ;)  
jstoldt - (12:56): so you could just like read to the end and then go to the next page  
jstoldt - (12:56): or previous...  
jstoldt - (12:57): so how would i apply the container macro (or any other) to achieve this?  
lucaa - (12:58): there could be a trick you could use for the container macro  
jstoldt - (12:59): tell me all about it :-D  
lucaa - (12:59): but normally, by default, the container macro does not handle this situation specifically  
lucaa - (12:59): put your links in a container macro with layout columns, each in one column  
lucaa - (12:59): {{container layout='columns'}}(((firstLink)))(((secondlLink))){{/container}}  
lucaa - (13:00): I might be wrong on the param names, though  
lucaa - (13:00): lemme try it  
jstoldt - (13:00): will try  
jstoldt - (13:00): {{container justify="true" layoutStyle="columns"/}}  
jstoldt - (13:00): btw, this is what i got from the WYSIWYG  
lucaa - (13:01): edit and put the two groups in the content of the container  
lucaa - (13:01): (((firstLink)))  
lucaa - (13:01): (((secondLink)))  
lucaa - (13:02): the links should be in wiki syntax, though  
jstoldt - (13:02): sure  
jstoldt - (13:02): okay, i get it to make some columns  
jstoldt - (13:02): no such luck for making secondlink justified to the right  
lucaa - (13:04): wait I am still testing my hack  
lucaa - (13:04): as I said, container macro is not made for this  
lucaa - (13:04): I am testing my styling hack that should do the job  
lucaa - (13:07): hack done  
lucaa - (13:07): here's how you do it  
lucaa - (13:07): in the second group  
lucaa - (13:07): the second group, write it like this  
lucaa - (13:08): (((  
lucaa - (13:08): (%style='text-align: right;'%)  
lucaa - (13:08): your link  
lucaa - (13:08): )))  
lucaa - (13:08): ( jstoldt ) and it will do the job  
jstoldt - (13:08): oh, splendid  
jstoldt - (13:08): i tried placnig that before ((( and it did not work  
jstoldt - (13:08): but your suggestion works  
lucaa - (13:09): well, that's an undocumented feature ;) of the container macro  
jstoldt - (13:09): well, the container macro is an undocumented feature to begin with... ;)  
lucaa - (13:09): it overwrites the style with it's own style, because it needs to produce the columned layout  
jstoldt - (13:09): yeah  
lucaa - (13:09): it should merge, though, to be correct  
lucaa - (13:09): but, if I am not wrong, that's an undocumented feature of the wiki syntax in general  
jstoldt - (13:10): anyway, it's still better having to install another unsupported macro  
lucaa - (13:10): (%%)(%%)text  
lucaa - (13:10): does not apply both styles  
jstoldt - (13:10): the (% style="..." %)?  
lucaa - (13:10): I need to check though  
lucaa - (13:10): I mean the style attributes override eachother, don't merge  
jstoldt - (13:10): well, i kinda picked it up somewhere. i think somebody gave me the hint and i've been using it since  
lucaa - (13:11): well, the idea is that style contains css  
lucaa - (13:11): normally when you put 2 groups one after the other, the style attribute of the second group will override the style attr of the first group  
lucaa - (13:11): when you'd expect the css to be merged  
jstoldt - (13:11): yeah, i think i see what you mean in the html  
jstoldt - (13:12): but to be honest, i don't think it's much of a bother  
jstoldt - (13:12): only a few extra bytes being transmitted  
lucaa - (13:12): e.g. if you write  
lucaa - (13:12): {{container justify="true" layoutStyle="columns"}}  
lucaa - (13:12): (((content1)))  
lucaa - (13:12): (%class="myclass"%)(((content2)))  
lucaa - (13:12): {{/container}}  
lucaa - (13:12): the class will be there  
jstoldt - (13:12): mhmm  
jstoldt - (13:13): oh well, it works now, thanks for that!  
lucaa - (13:14): jstoldt: actually I can fix that style thing easily for the container, I will  
jstoldt - (13:14): cool  
vmassol - (13:33): jvelociter: wdyt about the idea I've put in the sheet which is to include installation instructions by default for the type + extra installations if they exist:  
vmassol - (13:33):     = Installation Instructions =  
vmassol - (13:33):     {{include document="ExtensionCode.InstallationInstructionsFor${type}"/}}  
vmassol - (13:33):     #set($extraInstallation = $doc.getValue("installation"))  
vmassol - (13:33):     #if ($!extraInstallation != "")  
vmassol - (13:33):       $extraInstallation  
vmassol - (13:33):     #end

jvelociter - (14:19): yes

tmortagne - (15:26): and macros toot i think  
tmortagne - (15:26): \#mymacro

vmassol - (15:27): \#include( "a.txt" )

vmassol - (15:27): "Escaping VTL Directives" section

tmortagne - (15:28): it escape directive but not ##
